'''Nautilus armor''' is a type of [[armor]] that can be equipped on a tamed [[nautilus]] or [[zombie nautilus]] that reduces the damage received by the nautilus. There are five [[tiers]] of nautilus armor.

== Variants ==
* {{ItemLink|Copper Nautilus Armor}}
* {{ItemLink|Iron Nautilus Armor}}
* {{ItemLink|Golden Nautilus Armor}}
* {{ItemLink|Diamond Nautilus Armor}}
* {{ItemLink|Netherite Nautilus Armor}}

== Obtaining ==
Nautilus armor cannot be crafted.

=== Generated loot ===
{{LootChestItem|copper-nautilus-armor,iron-nautilus-armor,golden-nautilus-armor,diamond-nautilus-armor}}

=== Upgrading ===
{{Smithing|Netherite Upgrade|Diamond Nautilus Armor|Netherite Ingot|Netherite Nautilus Armor|head=1|tail=1}}

== Usage ==
Like [[horse armor]], nautilus armor does not have [[durability]].

=== Equipping ===
Nautilus armor can be equipped on a [[tamed]] nautilus or zombie nautilus by holding the nautilus armor and using the {{Control|use|text=use button}} on the nautilus.

The nautilus armor can be removed from a nautilus by {{control|using}} [[shears]] on it.

Baby nautiluses are unable to equip nautilus armor.

=== Protection ===
There is a gradual increase in protection for the nautilus from wearing different increasing tiers of nautilus armor.

=== Smelting ===
{{Smelting
|showname=1
|Copper Nautilus Armor; Iron Nautilus Armor; Golden Nautilus Armor
|Copper Nugget; Iron Nugget; Gold Nugget
|0,1
}}

=== Piglins ===
[[Piglin]]s are attracted to golden nautilus armor and can pick it up.<ref>{{bug|MC-302664||Piglins aren't attracted to golden nautilus armor|resolution=Fixed}}</ref>

=== Enchanting ===
Nautilus armor cannot be [[enchanted]] in Survival mode without commands. However, {{in|java}} Creative mode, an [[anvil]] can be used to enchant nautilus armor with [[Thorns]], [[Feather Falling]], [[Protection]], [[Fire Protection]], [[Projectile Protection]], [[Blast Protection]], [[Curse of Binding]], and [[Curse of Vanishing]]. Other enchantments can be applied, but they have no effect.
